description.narrative:
'This project provides children and parents with legal knowledge, focus on access to education and medical services in place of living. Besides, the project to improve the capacity for children to be able to actively develop ideas for solving their legalissues through art forms and design thinking approach. This process will develop children capacity to cope with new living environment as active and responsible city dwellers.
The project also contributes to the comprehensive development of children, especially 21st century skills such as communication, teamwork, critical thinking, cooperation and creativity. Moreover, the project also expects that, when participating, children will develop thinking ability of children at 5 levels: remembering, understanding, manipulating, analyzing, evaluating and creating (Pohl, 2000). Finally, the children in the project are given the opportunity to voice and message to adults in a more creative way, thereby preventing and reducing the risks of children at immigration.
Through participatory and gender focused, Service-Learning, Creative-lab and individual social work approaches, both male and female in the communities have equal chance to participate into project activities. Gender equity will be emphasized during the project activities to strengthen their confidence on their rights and to know where and whom they should to go to ask for help and how to protect themselves.
Last but not least, participated students, with the coaching from their faculties, willapply their specific knowledge and skills into targeted communities with the local context to sharpen their mindset and gain more experience.

participating-org.narrative: Service-learning center is one of the academic affiliates of Hoa Sen University. The Center has a mission to support lecturers and students in the implementation of Service-learning subjects and projects, connecting education and training with community service, contributing to the school's mission of liberal education. Service-learning helps graduates to be equipped with practical working skills, a sense of civic responsibility, and an international perspective on current social issues. Service-learning has become an asset of Hoa Sen University and a focal point in promoting the Service-learning movement of Vietnamese universities in general. Service-learning center of Hoa Sen University is responsible for developing Service-learning subjects and projects to address the real needs of the community, develop problem-solving skills, practical thinking, and building civic responsibility and leadership capacity for Hoa Sen University students. In addition, the Center is also responsible for developing scientific research related to Service-learning, connecting and building network of partners as well as improving the capacity of lecturers and community partners on Service-learning.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
